question:
Which of the following is / are correct statements regarding J. B. Kripalani, whose birth anniversary was observed recently (November 11):
  1. He actively took part in Non-Cooperation Movement, Salt Satyagraha, Civil Disobedience Movement as well as Quit India Movement
  2. He was elected for both Rajya Sabha as well as Lok Sabha after independence
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
J. B. Kripalani was born as Jivatram Bhagwandas Kripalani on November 11, 1888 in Hyderabad, Sind in a Hindu Kshatriya Amil family to Kaka Bhagwandas. Maulana Abul Kalam Azad was born Abul Kalam Ghulam Muhiyuddin on November 11, 1888 in Mecca, Islam\'s main center of pilgrimage.
Role of J B Kripalani in freedom struggle
  • In 1920, he committed himself to the Non-Cooperation Movement.
  • He worked on the ideology of social reforms and principles of education.
  • He actively took part in the Salt Satyagraha, Civil Disobedience Movement and Quit India Movement, for which he was arrested and imprisoned a multiple times.
  • From 1934 to 1945, he served as the General Secretary of the Indian National Congress.
  • He was elected as the member of the Lok Sabha for four times, in 1952, 1957, 1963 and 1967.
